summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message from Pastor Travis Hearn about trusting God's process! PT delivers a powerful sermon centered on Romans 8:28, reminding us that God is always working things out, even when we can't see it. Sometimes life throws us unexpected challenges that feel like setbacks, but Pastor Travis challenges us to see these moments as divine orchestrations. He shares personal stories, like getting a DUI at 17 that ultimately led him to Jesus, to illustrate how God can transform our most difficult moments into incredible opportunities. The sermon is a powerful reminder that God's ways are not our ways - He sees the entire picture while we only see a small piece. Pastor Travis encourages us to trust God's timing, thank Him in all circumstances, and understand that what the enemy means for harm, God can use for our good. The key message? God is always working it out, even when it doesn't make sense to us. We just need to trust, surrender, and believe that He is faithful!
mainPoints: Repent and turn back to God

versesMentioned.text: And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.

But God chose the foolish things of the world to shame the wise; God chose the weak things of the world to shame the strong. God chose the lowly things of this world and the despised things—and the things that are not—to nullify the things that are, so that no one may boast before him.

For my thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways my ways, declares the Lord. As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways and my thoughts than your thoughts.
Give thanks in all circumstances; for this is God's will for you in Christ Jesus.

The word of the Lord came to Jonah son of Amittai: 'Go to the great city of Nineveh and preach against it, because its wickedness has come up before me.' But Jonah ran away from the Lord and headed for Tarshish.
There is a way that appears to be right, but in the end it leads to death.
Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord.

Monday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Monday.focus: Trusting God's ultimate plan for your life
Monday.action: Write down three current challenges you're facing. Next to each, write a potential way God might be working through this situation. Reflect on how your perspective changes when you view challenges as opportunities.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me trust Your plan even when I can't see the full picture. Give me patience and faith to believe You are working all things together for my good. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Psalm 46:10: 'Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.'
Tuesday.focus: Learning to be still and trust God's process
Tuesday.action: Practice 10 minutes of silent meditation. During this time, resist the urge to problem-solve and instead focus on listening to God. Write down any insights or feelings that emerge.
Tuesday.prayer: God, teach me to be still and trust You. Help me quiet my mind and listen for Your guidance. Reveal Your peace that surpasses all understanding. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 4:6-7: 'Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.'
Wednesday.action: Create a gratitude journal. Write down three things you're thankful for, even in challenging circumstances. Reflect on how shifting to gratitude changes your perspective.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me choose thanksgiving over worry. Guard my heart and mind with Your supernatural peace. Help me see Your goodness in every situation. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance. Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.'
Thursday.focus: Understanding the purpose of life's challenges
Thursday.action: Identify a past challenge that ultimately led to personal growth. Journal about how that experience transformed you and what you learned.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me view challenges as opportunities for growth. Give me wisdom to see beyond my current circumstances and trust Your refining process. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Friday.focus: Surrendering control and trusting God's guidance
Friday.action: Make a list of areas in your life where you're trying to maintain control. Pray over each one, symbolically releasing them to God. Consider what steps of faith you might take.
Friday.prayer: God, I surrender my plans and desires to You. Help me trust Your guidance and move in faith, even when the path isn't clear. Direct my steps and help me follow Your lead. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Saturday.action: Review the week's journal entries. Identify moments where you saw God's hand at work, even in small ways. Share one of these stories with a friend or family member.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for Your constant work in my life. Help me recognize Your faithfulness and share Your goodness with others. Increase my trust in Your perfect plan. Amen.
